intro: Wilcoxia mariana, commonly known as the Santa Barbara dudleya, is a rare succulent native to the coastal regions of California. It belongs to the Portulacaceae family and is characterized by its fleshy, spiny leaves and small, yellowish flowers. The plant thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to a Mediterranean climate with dry summers and wet winters. Due to habitat loss and climate change, it is considered endangered and is protected under conservation efforts. Its unique appearance and limited distribution make it a notable species in botanical studies.
